intro: Steganthus urophyllus, commonly known as the golden crownbeard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant produces bright yellow ray flowers surrounded by a dense cluster of small, tubular disk flowers. Its foliage consists of narrow, grass-like leaves that are often covered in fine hairs. Steganthus urophyllus is typically found in rocky, well-drained soils and is adapted to full sun exposure.
